intro: Lastrea lindmanii, commonly known as the Lindman's lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
